author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Hastings featured at Jackson Memorial
text:
Hastings featured at Jackson Memorial Oct 14, 2015 "Elizabeth Ann" is part of the show of work by St. George artist David C. Hastings at Jackson Memorial Library in Tenants Harbor. 
Tenants Harbor — Jackson Memorial Library, 71 Main St./Route 131, is showcasing works by St. George artist David C. Hastings through Dec. 5. The library display features a variety of pieces including different media from Hastings' collection. 
The public is invited to and opening reception Thursday, Oct. 15, from 5 to 7 p.m. The event offers the opportunity to view the artwork and speak with the artist while enjoying light refreshments. 
A graduate of Rochester Institute of Technology and Winona School of Professional Photography, Hastings began his career as a New York-based photo-illustrator, producing advertising photography for many Fortune 500 companies. His award-winning work has been recognized nationally, and he holds a degree of Master of Photography. 
After a 20-year hiatus from photography and retirement from the advertising field, Hastings developed an interest in computers. Digital photography became a natural retirement avocation and a new passion for visual art grew. He takes pride in personalizing his selection and interpretation of subjects in unique ways, making no limitations on materials or methods in the production of his art. 
Jackson Memorial Library is a nonprofit private library serving the town of St. George, providing enrichment programs for all ages. The library is proud to partner with local artists and share a wide variety of artwork with the community. The library receives a 30 percent commission from the sale of art. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
